summary: An internal FBI email from the New York Field Office discussing coordination and reporting requirements for the Epstein investigation following his death. It focuses on managing media narratives, investigative priorities regarding co-conspirators, and preparation for an upcoming court hearing.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: Referenced as a co-conspirator in the case, with media attention focused on her location and role. The email indicates the investigative team is currently focused on charges for a different co-conspirator.

events.title: Interview of MCC Corrections Officer
events.description: An interview of one MCC Corrections Officer was scheduled for 4pm at the New York Office (NYO).

events.title: Daily HQ Conference Call Established
events.description: Headquarters (HQ) requested daily updates via a conference call at 1530, driven largely by the DOJ.

events.title: Upcoming Court Hearing
events.description: Referenced as a "big day" with a hearing, requiring preparation on the prior Monday. The email mentions coordinating transportation for victims expected to attend.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively investigating co-conspirators in the Epstein case following his death, with a focus on building charges against at least one specific individual other than Ghislaine Maxwell.
The email reveals internal pressure and reporting requirements from DOJ headquarters, with daily conference calls established to manage the high-profile investigation.
Investigative efforts included interviews of MCC Corrections Officers (14 conducted), financial analysis, and analysis of phones.
The FBI was coordinating with victims for an upcoming court hearing, including arranging transportation.
The communication advises agents to manage media narratives proactively, specifically citing media focus on Maxwell's role, and to be cautious in reporting details to senior leadership.
